TopicTitle: A short little WWIIish KSP story.

Articles.Content:

(Is there any topic here at all yet?) I wrote a story in to sort of work on my ability to have characters say stuff, and/or to even have unique characters, so I wrote this. Here it is. P.S. My great grandfather flew a divebomber much like those in this story in WWII. He was shot down at the battle of the Coral Sea after having led the attacks that sank one japanese carrier and damaged another. He was on the carrier Lexington, which was sunk their. He was awarded the Posthumous Navy Cross and had a naval airfield, Ault Field, named after him, as well as the destroyer USS Ault. I guess this is kind of a tribute to him.
My grandfather served two weeks before being discharged because the war ended

I've tried to use firespitter in the past (1.0.4). My bomber I tried to make would load and then fly at ridiculous speeds for about half a second before exploding. My F-86's wings produced more lift. KAX has had no problems like that, except for a sudden annoying lack of noise from the propellers, as well as a loss of animations. The jumpjets work, and all the parts produce thrust the same.
